clinical_study.brief_title: Using Spectrally Encoded Confocal Microscopy (SECM) to Visualise the Esophagus Using an SECM Probe
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Image the Esophagus Using a SECM Probe

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is being done to test the feasibility and tolerability of a SECM imaging probe in patients with Barrett's Esophagus (BE).
A total of 12 subjects will undergo SECM probe imaging while they are under conscious sedation. Spiral SECM imaging will be performed continuously over a pre-determined length. Patients will later be asked for their feedback.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects with a previous diagnosis of Barrett's Esophagus will be recruited in the study and undergo SECM probe imaging while using conscious sedation, pulse oximetry and blood pressure monitoring. The probe will be inserted the predetermined required distance in the esophagus using a guide wire.
Once the SECM imaging probe is in place, spiral SECM image data will be continuously collected over a pre-determined length (approximately 5cm).

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability of SECM Probe and imaging in patients with BE
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is expected that the total examination time including insertion, SECM imaging and removal of the probe will add approximately 10 minutes to the total length of the esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD)
primary_outcome.description: After participating in the study, the subject will be asked for feedback about tolerability of the procedure using a questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of SECM Probe and imaging in patients with BE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: It is expected that the total examination time including insertion, SECM imaging and removal of the probe will add approximately 10 minutes to the total length of the EGD
secondary_outcome.description: An investigator will assess the quality of the recorded images and movies obtained with each exam after the imaging is completed.

arm_group.description: SECM probe will be guided to a pre-determined length in the esophagus and spiral imaging will be performed using the SECM Imaging System.

intervention.description: Imaging of the esophagus using SECM probe and system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A previous diagnosis of Barrett's Esophagus
- Patients must be over the age of 18
- Patient must be able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any history of intestinal strictures
- OR subjects with a history of prior GI surgery
- OR subjects with a history of intestinal Crohn's disease.
